description: A modern take on a classic family recipe. This simple way to cook roast beef is extra delicious served with cauliflower, carrots and extra balsamic glaze.
keywords: Roast beef,Roast,Low salt,Seafood free,Tree nut free,Egg free,Winter,Low sugar,Sesame free,Budget,Beef,High protein,High fibre,Christmas,Soy free,Wheat free,Cauliflower,Easter,Dairy free,Peanut free
name: Roast Beef with Balsamic Cauliflower & Carrots Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 2 tbs fresh continental parsley, chopped (to serve)
3 tbs olive oil (save 2 tbs for balsamic cauliflower & carrots)
2 tbs fresh thyme leaves (save 1 tbs fresh thyme leaves for balsamic cauliflower & carrots)

recipeInstructions.text: Remove beef from refrigerator and bring to room temperature for 30 minutes before cooking. Preheat oven 200째C fan-forced.
Combine oil, garlic, mustard and thyme in a bowl. Season. Spread mixture all over the beef. Place beef on a wire rack in a shallow roasting tray.
Place beef in oven, then reduce oven temperature to 160째C fan-forced. Cook beef for 50 minutes for medium rare. Remove beef from oven, cover loosely with foil and rest for 20 minutes.

Increase oven to 220째C fan-forced. Combine cauliflower, carrots, oil and thyme leaves in a bowl. Season. Toss to coat. Tip out onto a large baking paper-lined oven tray and spread out. Roast for 15 minutes or until tender. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon of the balsamic glaze and a little extra oil.

Carve beef and serve with roasted cauliflower & Carrots scattered with parsley with extra balsamic glaze to the side. Tip 1: If you don't have a wire-rack, thickly slice 2 large onions and lay onto base of pan in place of a rack. Tip 2: For medium rare roast at 160째C fan-forced for 25-30 minutes per 500g. Tip 3: Serve with traditional beef gravy if you prefer.
